case_vignette: A 33-year-old Black man presents to    a dermatology clinic with a 5-month history of asymptomatic lesions on his arms and trunk. He is otherwise healthy with no    personal    or family history of skin disease. He  has no history of    fever, cough, shortness of breath, or j oint pain. The patient has not tried any treatments for these lesions. On examination, th   ere are several smooth, well-demarcated hypopi gmented plaques on his upper arms and left flank. He has no similar lesions elsewhere on his body.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been noticing some light-colored, smooth patches on my upper arms and left side of my body.
Have these patches changed in size or spread recently?
No, they have not changed in size or spread recently.
Do the patches itch or cause any discomfort?
No, the patches do not cause any itching or discomfort.
Do you have a history of similar skin issues or any other chronic skin conditions?
No, I have no personal or family history of skin disease.
Have you recently started using any new medications, soaps, or lotions?
No, I have not started using any new medications, soaps, or lotions.
Is there any loss of skin color in those patches, or do they seem paler than your normal skin tone?
Yes, the patches are paler than my normal skin tone.
Final Diagnosis: Vitiligo.
